CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;Violation of P1-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the village of GPE , the GPE - Frankivs'k region of GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant 's family was placed on the waiting list to receive an apartment from the ORG . By DATE the applicant was first on the housing list . Nevertheless , ORG of ORG , by a decision of CARDINAL DATE , gave an available apartment to another person . The applicant instituted proceedings in the PERSON ORG against the executive committee of ORG , challenging its decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the GPE - Frankivs'k ORG found for the applicant and ordered ORG to assign the disputed apartment to the applicant . On DATE , ORG upheld the decision of ORG .

CARDINAL . In DATE , as the judgment in her favour remained unenforced , the applicant requested ORG to change the manner of enforcement and to order ORG to build her a house . On DATE , the court satisfied the applicant 's request and changed the manner of execution accordingly .

CARDINAL . In DATE , as the judgment was still unenforced , the applicant requested the same district court to change the manner of execution again and to award her the pecuniary equivalent of the disputed apartment . On DATE , ORG satisfied the applicant 's request and awarded her ORG CARDINAL in compensation .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the Head of ORG of ORG issued an order to freeze all the current bank accounts of ORG in order to secure the payment of the judgment debt in the applicant 's favour .
CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG challenged the order of DATE in ORG . The enforcement proceedings were accordingly suspended .

CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG found in part for ORG and quashed the order of ORG with respect to CARDINAL principal accounts containing the budget funds for social payments , salaries , etc . By the same decision the court allowed the other accounts of the debtor to be frozen .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant lodged a protest with the Deputy Chairman of the GPE - Frankivs'k ORG to challenge this decision . The Deputy Chairman rejected her protest by his letter of DATE . On DATE , the panel of CARDINAL judges of ORG of ORG of GPE rejected the applicant 's request for leave to appeal under the new cassation procedure .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court decision of DATE was enforced in full and the Bailiffs ended the enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is summarised in the judgment of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
